title: Priest
data:
***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

*This article is about the obsolete player background. For information on monster priests, see their specific articles.*

**Priests** are religious devotees of [Zin](/Zin "Zin"), the ancient and revered God of Law. [Hill Orc](/Hill_Orc "Hill Orc") Priests instead serve the Orc god [Beogh](/Beogh "Beogh"). All Priests have some training in combat skills, but their main power comes from the [Invocations](/Invocations "Invocations") granted by their god.

Priests start with 45 [piety](/Piety "Piety").

## Contents

- [1 Racial Restrictions](#Racial_Restrictions)
- [2 Starting Equipment](#Starting_Equipment)
- [3 Starting Skills](#Starting_Skills)
- [4 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [5 History](#History)

## Racial Restrictions

[Demigods](/Demigod "Demigod"), [Mummies](/Mummies "Mummies"), [Demonspawn](/Demonspawn "Demonspawn"), [Ghouls](/Ghoul "Ghoul"), and [Vampires](/Vampire "Vampire") cannot be Priests. [Hill Orc](/Hill_Orc "Hill Orc") Priests serve [Beogh](/Beogh "Beogh") instead of Zin.

## Starting Equipment

Most species receive the following, though some [species](/Species "Species") may receive different items based on their unique restrictions.

- +0 [quarterstaff](/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff")
- +0 [robe](/Robe "Robe")
- [Bread ration](/Bread_ration "Bread ration")
- 20 [gold](/Gold "Gold")

Hill Orc Priests instead receive:

- +0 orcish [hand axe](/Hand_axe "Hand axe")
- +0 orcish [robe](/Robe "Robe")
- [Meat ration](/Meat_ration "Meat ration")
- 20 [gold](/Gold "Gold")

## Starting Skills

These are adjusted by your species' [aptitudes](/Aptitude "Aptitude").

- [Fighting](/Fighting "Fighting"): 2
- Chosen Weapon's Skill: 3
- [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging"): 1
- [Invocations](/Invocations "Invocations"): 5

## Strategy

Like [Monks](/Monk "Monk"), Priests start with worse gear and weapons, but have a head start with their god. Recommended species include [High Elf](/High_Elf "High Elf"), [Minotaur](/Minotaur "Minotaur"), and [Hill Orc](/Hill_Orc "Hill Orc") which are strong in the early dungeon. As with all religious classes, it is not mandatory to play a Priest to worship Zin / Beogh, but priests start with Invocations skill, and start gaining piety earlier.

Unlike in certain other RPGs, priests are not restricted in their choice of equipment - though [Beogh](/Beogh "Beogh") boosts the power of [orcish equipment](/Racial_equipment "Racial equipment"). Priest's powers are not tied to healing or buffing, either. However, they *are* bound to the behavior restrictions laid down by their chosen god (at least if they want to avoid [divine retribution](/Divine_retribution "Divine retribution")).

[Zin](/Zin "Zin") does not inflict wrath on abandonment, unless you switch to an evil or chaotic god ([Makhleb](/Makhleb "Makhleb"), [Lugonu](/Lugonu "Lugonu"), [Kiku](/Kiku "Kiku"), [Yred](/Yred "Yred"), [Jiyva](/Jiyva "Jiyva"), [Xom](/Xom "Xom")). Some priests may find it reasonable to switch to another god, using their background for the quarter staff and Invocations skill.

## History

- The Priest background was removed in [0.13](/0.13 "0.13").
